CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . Synthesis and Physical Properties of Polymers. The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride carried out in diluted dichloromethane ( DCM ) solution yielded a dark purple benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone ( 2 ) crystal. Acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride performed under basic conditions produced yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate ( 3 ) powder in a good yield of 85% . 3 was then alkylated with 2ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 yielding 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene ( 4 ) as a sticky colorless liquid. Proton abstraction of 4 by n-BuLi followed by the reaction with tri-butyltin chloride gave the polycondensation precursor , 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene ( 5 ). To preserve high reactivity , the crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20 °C for the condensation reaction. Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). Subsequent coupling with 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole afforded dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole , 14-17. NBS bromination of 14-17 produced the acceptor units , 18-21 , respectively , which were carefully purified through chromatography and recrystallization to ensure high reactivity for the condensation reaction. The Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21 was carried out under the catalyst of Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 in chlorobenzene solutions at 150 °C for 3 days that could afford the corresponding polymers as a dark green solid. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. PffBBn: PC71BM - based PSCs (Blend of PffBBn and PC71BM in Polymer Solar Cells)
2. PffBB-14 (Specific PffBBn polymer with strongest aggregation strength)
3. 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (Chemical compound 1)
4. Benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (Chemical compound 2)
5. Benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (Chemical compound 3)
6. 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (Chemical compound 4)
7. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene (Polycondensation precursor 5)
8. 3-alkylthiophene (Chemical compound 6-9, depending on the alkyl group)
9. Tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (Chemical compound 10-13, depending on the alkyl group)
10. Dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (Chemical compound 14-17, depending on the substituents)
11. 18-21 (Acceptor units, specific chemical compounds)
12. Polymers (Synthesized polymers from the Stille polycondensation reaction)

| --- |
| PffBBn: PC71BM - based PSCs |
| PffBB-14 |
| 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1) |
| Benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (2) |
| Benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3) |
| 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4) |
| 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene (5) |
| 3-alkylthiophene (6-9) |
| Tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13) |
| Dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (14-17) |
| Polymers |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Morphological order change of the blend layer |
| PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) |
| Voc (Open Circuit Voltage) |
| Jsc (Short Circuit Current Density) |
| FF (Fill Factor) |
| Exciton dissociation |
| Charge carrier mobilities |
| Recombination losses in the active layer |
| Yield (of various reactions) |
| Molecular weight |

| Property Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Morphological order change of the blend layer | The change in morphology of the blend layer due to temperature tuning and structural modification. |
| PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) | The percentage of the incident light that is converted into electrical energy in a solar cell. |
| Voc (Open Circuit Voltage) | The voltage at which the photovoltaic cell generates an open circuit current. |
| Jsc (Short Circuit Current Density) | The maximum current density that a photovoltaic cell can generate at an open circuit voltage. |
| FF (Fill Factor) | The ratio of the maximum reversible power output of a photovoltaic cell to the product of its open circuit voltage and short circuit current. |
| Exciton dissociation | The process by which an exciton (an electron-hole pair) separates into free electrons and holes. |
| Charge carrier mobilities | The measure of how easily charge carriers (electrons or holes) move through a material. |
| Recombination losses in the active layer | The loss of charge carriers due to recombination (the combination of an electron and a hole to form a neutral pair) in the active layer of a solar cell. |
| Yield (of various reactions) | The amount of desired product obtained from a chemical reaction, expressed as a percentage of the theoretical maximum yield. |
| Molecular weight | The mass of a single molecule of a substance, expressed in grams or atomic mass units. |

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Maximum PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based cell: 9.93%
2. Voc (Open Circuit Voltage) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based cell: 0.92 V
3. Jsc (Short Circuit Current Density) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based cell: 16.77 mA cm^-2
4. FF (Fill Factor) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based cell: 64.36%
5. Yield of 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1): 70%
6. Yield of benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (2): N/A (not mentioned)
7. Yield of yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3): 85%
8. Molecular weight of synthesized polymers: N/A (values not provided in the text)

* Alkylation of the thiophene ring (alkylation of 3-alkylthiophene)
* Subsequent coupling with 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole

* Molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent (Table 1)

These entities were removed because they describe the synthesis process and the experimental conditions, rather than the material properties.
